content: Hello David, Thank you so much for reading and for sharing that interesting linguistic trivia! I am not surprised by the overlap. Urdu was a language born out of a concoction of multiple influences — Persian, Hindi and Sanskrit being the predominant ones, but also several others. There is a possibility that Hebrew influences had also crept in unnoticed, or perhaps our languages share their roots to a much larger extent that we can even imagine! It is such a beautiful, humbling thought! :) Gair rhymes with Hair with a soft ‘i’ and a dominant, rolled ‘r’. :) I loved the commandment you shared. It resonated beautifully with the thought behind this piece and was also a reminder of how Universal all these wisdoms actually are! Thank you! :)
